target_content: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials, 50% for lithium, no later than 31 December 2027
justification: The implementation of TA3.23 is likely to have a positive impact on TA4.28, as the increased recycling of lithium and other materials can support the development of sustainable and environmentally friendly transportation systems, including the deployment of electric vehicles and related infrastructure.

target_content: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials, 50% for lithium, no later than 31 December 2027
justification: The successful implementation of TA3.23 can also positively impact TA4.30, as the increased availability of recycled materials can contribute to the reduction of packaging waste and support the development of more sustainable packaging solutions.

target_content: Reduce the generation of food waste in processing and manufacturing by 10% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
justification: The reduction of food waste in TA3.24 may have a negative impact on TA5.2, as the decreased food waste generation could lead to reduced availability of organic waste for energy production, potentially affecting the overall energy mix and greenhouse gas emissions.

target_content: Reduce the generation of food waste per capita, jointly in retail and other distribution of food, in restaurants and food services and in households, by 30% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
justification: Similarly, the implementation of TA3.25 may negatively affect TA5.3, as the reduced food waste generation could lead to decreased nutrient losses, potentially impacting the overall nutrient cycle and affecting the reduction of nutrient losses in the environment.

target_content: All packaging shall be recyclable
justification: The requirement for all packaging to be recyclable in TA3.27 is likely to have a positive impact on TA4.32, as the increased recyclability of packaging materials can support the development of more sustainable and environmentally friendly packaging solutions for the transportation sector.

target_content: The plastic part in packaging shall contain the following minimum percentage of recycled content recovered from post-consumer plastic waste
justification: The implementation of TA3.28 can also positively impact TA4.33, as the increased use of recycled content in packaging can support the development of more sustainable and environmentally friendly packaging solutions for the transportation sector, including inland waterway vessels.

target_content: Each Member State shall reduce the packaging waste generated per capita, as compared to the packaging waste generated per capita in 2018
justification: The reduction of packaging waste in TA3.30 is likely to have a positive impact on TA4.34, as the decreased packaging waste generation can support the development of more sustainable and environmentally friendly packaging solutions for the transportation sector, including seagoing container ships and seagoing passenger ships.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain the recycling targets of 65% by weight of all packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
justification: The implementation of TA3.31 can positively impact TA4.55, as the increased recycling of packaging waste can support the development of more sustainable and environmentally friendly transportation systems, including the reduction of emissions from urban logistics.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 50% of plastic by weight of plastic contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
justification: The increased recycling of plastic packaging waste in TA3.32 may have a negative impact on TA5.4, as the focus on recycling plastic waste could potentially divert attention and resources away from reducing the use of more hazardous pesticides and other harmful substances.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 25% of wood by weight of wood contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
justification: The implementation of TA3.33 can positively impact TA5.6, as the increased recycling of wood packaging waste can support the development of more sustainable and environmentally friendly aquaculture and fisheries practices.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 70% of ferrous metals by weight of ferrous metals contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
justification: The increased recycling of ferrous metals in TA3.34 may have a negative impact on TA5.7, as the focus on recycling metal waste could potentially divert attention and resources away from reducing greenhouse gas emissions from agriculture, fisheries, and aquaculture.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 50% of aluminium by weight of aluminium contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
justification: Similarly, the implementation of TA3.35 may negatively affect TA5.8, as the increased recycling of aluminium packaging waste could lead to decreased focus on reducing water pollution and preserving freshwater resources.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 70% of glass by weight of glass contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
justification: The increased recycling of glass packaging waste in TA3.36 is likely to have a positive impact on TA5.9, as the development of more sustainable and environmentally friendly packaging solutions can support the increase of organic farming and the reduction of synthetic fertilizers and pesticides.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 75% of paper and cardboard by weight of paper and cardboard contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
justification: The implementation of TA3.37 can positively impact TA5.10, as the increased recycling of paper and cardboard packaging waste can support the development of more sustainable and environmentally friendly energy production and consumption practices in the agriculture and food sector.

target_content: By 31 December 2030, in each safe and secure parking area at least four publicly accessible recharging stations dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles
justification: The deployment of publicly accessible recharging stations for heavy-duty electric vehicles in TA4.28 can positively impact TA3.23, as the increased demand for electric vehicles can drive the development of more sustainable and environmentally friendly transportation systems, including the increased recycling of lithium and other materials.

target_content: By 31 December 2030, in each urban node publicly accessible recharging points dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles
justification: The implementation of TA4.29 can also positively impact TA3.24, as the increased availability of recharging points for heavy-duty electric vehicles can support the reduction of food waste generation in processing and manufacturing.

target_content: By 31 December 2030, at least one publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling station is deployed in each urban node
justification: The deployment of hydrogen refuelling stations in TA4.30 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.25, as the increased availability of alternative fuels can support the reduction of food waste generation per capita.

target_content: By 31 December 2030, publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling stations with a total capacity of at least 1 tonne per day
justification: The implementation of TA4.31 can positively impact TA3.27, as the increased availability of hydrogen refuelling stations can support the development of more sustainable and environmentally friendly packaging solutions.

target_content: By 31 December 2029, the provision of electricity supply to stationary aircraft is ensured
justification: The provision of electricity supply to stationary aircraft in TA4.32 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.28, as the increased use of electric power can support the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions from transportation and the development of more sustainable packaging solutions.

target_content: By 1 January 2025, at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed
justification: The deployment of shore-side electricity supply installations for inland waterway vessels in TA4.33 can positively impact TA3.30, as the increased use of electric power can support the reduction of packaging waste generation per capita.

target_content: Zero-emission in urban logistics
justification: The implementation of zero-emission urban logistics in TA4.55 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.31, as the increased use of electric and alternative fuels can support the development of more sustainable and environmentally friendly transportation systems, including the increased recycling of packaging waste.

target_content: Reduce overall EU sales of antimicrobials for farmed animals and in aquaculture by 50% by 2030
justification: The reduction of antimicrobial sales in TA5.2 may have a negative impact on TA3.24, as the decreased use of antimicrobials could lead to reduced food waste generation in processing and manufacturing, potentially affecting the overall food system.

target_content: Reduce nutrient losses by at least 50%, while ensuring that there is no deterioration in soil fertility
justification: The implementation of TA5.3 can negatively impact TA3.25, as the focus on reducing nutrient losses could potentially divert attention and resources away from reducing food waste generation per capita.

target_content: Reduce by 50% the use of more hazardous pesticides
justification: The reduction of hazardous pesticide use in TA5.4 may have a negative impact on TA3.32, as the decreased use of pesticides could lead to reduced recycling of plastic packaging waste, potentially affecting the overall packaging waste management.

target_content: Reduce by 50% the use and risk of chemical pesticides
justification: Similarly, the implementation of TA5.5 can negatively affect TA3.33, as the focus on reducing chemical pesticide use could potentially divert attention and resources away from reducing wood packaging waste.

target_content: Ensure that agriculture, fisheries and aquaculture, and the food value chain contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
justification: The implementation of TA5.6 can negatively impact TA3.34, as the focus on reducing greenhouse gas emissions from agriculture, fisheries, and aquaculture could potentially divert attention and resources away from reducing ferrous metal packaging waste.

target_content: Ensure that agriculture, fisheries and aquaculture, and the food value chain contribute to the achievement of the objective for a climate-neutral Union in 2050
justification: The implementation of TA5.7 can negatively affect TA3.35, as the focus on achieving climate neutrality could potentially divert attention and resources away from reducing aluminium packaging waste.

target_content: Preserving freshwater, boosting water reuse in agriculture
justification: The preservation of freshwater resources in TA5.8 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.36, as the increased focus on water conservation and reuse can support the development of more sustainable and environmentally friendly packaging solutions, including the increased recycling of glass packaging waste.

target_content: Increase organic farming with the aim to achieve at least 25% of total farmland under organic farming by 2030
justification: The increase of organic farming in TA5.9 can positively impact TA3.37, as the development of more sustainable and environmentally friendly agricultural practices can support the increased recycling of paper and cardboard packaging waste.

target_content: Energy: Increase renewable energy in the agriculture and food sector
justification: The increase of renewable energy in the agriculture and food sector in TA5.10 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.38, as the development of more sustainable and environmentally friendly energy production and consumption practices can support the increased recycling of packaging waste and the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions.
